newsitem.title: FRANCE: Algeria's inflation drops to 18.7 percent in 1996.
newsitem.headline: Algeria's inflation drops to 18.7 percent in 1996.

text.p: Algeria's inflation dropped to 18.7 percent in 1996 from 29.8 percent in the previous year due to demand decline, stable exchange rate and stagnation of domestic prices, the official APS news agency said on Friday.

Quoting a report released by the official council Conseil National Economique et Social (CNES), APS said: "The inflation rhythm registered a slow pace in 1996 to 18.7 percent from 29.8 percent in 1995."
